author: khaffner
body: Now that Debian 10 Stable is released, could we get official support for this version? Thanks! 👍

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
We typically snap to underlying .NET support, and it looks like they're adding support for Debian 10 (listed as "9+") on the [.NET Core 3.0 support page](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/3.0/3.0-supported-os.md), as opposed to just "9" on the [2.2 support page](https://github.com/dotnet/core/blob/master/release-notes/2.2/2.2-supported-os.md). 

So yeah, we should probably try and have a Debian 10 package by the time 7.0 GAs.

comments.author: bergmeister
comments.body: Yes, in fact their default SDK docker images tagged with 3.0 are even based on Debian 10

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: The Debian 10 docker image was JUST released.  I went to filed this image based on dependabot opening a PR in the PowerShell docker repo yesterday.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: The process will be, we will create a docker image, support it experimentally until it is tested, and once tested we can officially support it.  We need to document this process for new Linux distribution releases.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: Filed an issue using the Distribution Support request template #10255

comments.author: msftbot[bot]
comments.body: This issue has been marked as duplicate and has not had any activity for **1 day**. It has been closed for housekeeping purposes.

title: Support for Debian 10
